title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 63.13 - Non-patient specific orders and protocols
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 63.13 - Non-patient specific orders and protocols

State Regulations

Orders to dispense drugs to prevent human immunodeficiency
virus (HIV) infection. A licensed pharmacist may, pursuant to a non-patient
specific order and protocol issued by a licensed physician in accordance with
section
60.12
of this Title or by a
certified nurse practitioner in accordance with section
64.5
(h) of this

Title, dispense up to a seven day supply of HIV post-exposure prophylaxis drugs
for the purpose of preventing HIV infection in persons who have potentially
been exposed to HIV. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
63.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
